pages.text: Repenomamus was a genus of mammal that lived during the Early Cretaceous Period (approximately 125-120 million years ago) in what is now China. It was a large, carnivorous mammal that likely fed on small dinosaurs and other animals. Repenomamus is known from several species, the largest of which was Repenomamus giganticus, which was about the size of a badger. It is one of the largest known Mesozoic mammals and represents an important example of early mammalian diversity.
Repenomamus: The Killer Rat who evaded a hammer in Whack-A-Mole many times.
